intro: Octarrhena cauligera, commonly known as the desert thistle, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters, characterized by its robust stems and spiny leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers in dense, globular clusters, which bloom in the summer months. It is well adapted to harsh environments, with deep roots that allow it to access water from deeper soil layers. Octarrhena cauligera is often found in rocky habitats and is valued for its resilience and ornamental appeal.
